DOC.brief_summary: To determine whether women exposed to the continence promotion intervention will report improved urinary symptoms and quality of life, and lower incontinence-related stigma and falls than women who receive a control intervention at one-year post-intervention.
DOC.brief_title: Continence Across Continents to Upend Stigma and Dependency
DOC.detailed_description: This is a cluster-randomized 4-site intervention study testing the effect of a continence-promotion intervention on: 1. Improved urinary symptoms and quality of life 2. Reduction in falls 3. Reduction in stigma A cost-effectiveness component will also be included
DOC.criteria: Women 65 years and older Urinary incontinence at least once weekly Living in residential or longterm care Received treatment for incontinence within the past year Dementia or other neurological conditions that preclude the ability to provide Informed consent
